abstract: Financier Carl Icahn has offered $156.5 million to acquire the partially built Fontainebleau Las Vegas resort, which has been stalled in bankruptcy court since June, according to the resort’s chief operating officer.
snippet: Financier Carl Icahn has offered $156.5 million to acquire the partially built Fontainebleau Las Vegas resort, which has been stalled in bankruptcy court since June, according to the resort’s chief operating officer.
lead_paragraph: The financier Carl C. Icahn has offered $156.5 million to acquire the partially built Fontainebleau Las Vegas resort, which has been stalled in bankruptcy court since June, according to the resort’s chief operating officer.

headline.main: Icahn Outbids Penn for Fontainebleau Las Vegas
